mdRecord.dcterms:title: Annie Laurie
Maxwelton Braes are bonnie
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Douglas, William, 1672?-1748 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in three verses; without music. Printed in black on letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First line: Maxwelton Braes are bonnie [original]

With advertisements "500 Illustrated Ballads, lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York. Branch Office: No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C." followed by "Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 Cents." [original]
Words by William Douglas of Fingland; music by Lady John Scott. Cf. Oxford Dictionary of Music. [original]

Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint appear to have been published in 1863 and 1864. [original]

Hand-colored illustration of a woman standing, holding apron full of flowers with flower garland in upper left corner, the whole within a double-rule border. Magnus 237A. Cf. American song sheets, 45f. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Twenty-first of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Love songs--Texts
